titles.en: Chapter 107 – Marrying the slave girl (with Mut’a)
Chapter 107 – Marrying the slave girl (with Mut’a)

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (20/251)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا يُتَمَتَّعُ بِالْأَمَةِ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ أَهْلِهَا .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Nasr,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan Al-Rezaasws having said: ‘Do not marry by Mut’a with the slave girl except with the permission of her owner’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu Nasr who has said the following: “Abu al-Hassan al-Rida’, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Marriage in the manner of al-Mut‘ah (advantageous marriage) is not permissible with a slave-girl without the permission of her people.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (20/252)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ عِيسَى بْنِ أَبِي مَنْصُورٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا بَأْسَ بِأَنْ يَتَزَوَّجَ الْأَمَةَ مُتْعَةً بِإِذْنِ مَوْلَاهَا .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Abdullah Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, form Aban Bin Usman, from Isa Bin Abu Mansour,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘There is no problem if you were to marry the slave girl by Mut’a with the permission of her master’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from ‘Abd Allah ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Aban ibn ‘Uthman from ‘Isa ibn abu Mansur who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘It is not unlawful to marry a slave-girl in the manner of al-Mut‘ah (advantageous marriage) by the permission of her master.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح وآخره مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (0/252)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) هَلْ لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يَتَمَتَّعَ مِنَ الْمَمْلُوكَةِ بِإِذْنِ أَهْلِهَا وَ لَهُ امْرَأَةٌ حُرَّةٌ قَالَ نَعَمْ إِذَا رَضِيَتِ الْحُرَّةُ قُلْتُ فَإِنْ أَذِنَتِ الْحُرَّةُ يَتَمَتَّعُ مِنْهَا قَالَ نَعَمْ .
وَ رُوِيَ أَيْضاً أَنَّهُ لَا يَجُوزُ أَنْ يُتَمَتَّعَ بِالْأَمَةِ عَلَى الْحُرَّةِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Muhammad Bin Ismail who said,

‘I asked Abu Al-Hassanasws, ‘Is it for the man that he marries by Mut’a to the slave girl with the permission of her owner, and for him there is (already) a free woman (as a wife)?’ Heasws said: ‘Yes, when the free woman agrees’. I said, ‘Supposing the free woman (wife) were to allow, can he marry by Mut’a from them?’ Heasws said: ‘Yes’.
And it is reported as well that he<sup>asws</sup> did not allow that he one should marry with the slave girl (as an additional wife) upon the free woman’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Muhammad ibn ‘Isma’il who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, ‘A man has a free wife; if he can marry a slave-girl in the manner of al-Mut‘ah (advantageous marriage) by the permission of her master.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, he can do so.’ It also is narrated that marriage of a slave-girl in the manner of al-Mut‘ah (advantageous marriage) when one has a free wife is not permissible.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (20/252)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ سَيْفِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا بَأْسَ بِأَنْ يَتَمَتَّعَ الرَّجُلُ بِأَمَةِ الْمَرْأَةِ فَأَمَّا أَمَةُ الرَّجُلِ فَلَا يَتَمَتَّعْ بِهَا إِلَّا بِأَمْرِهِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al hakam, from Sayf Bin Qmeyra,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘There is no problem with it if a man were to marry with a slave girl of the woman. So, as for a slave girl of the man, so he cannot do Mut’a with her except with his instruction’.
en.sarwar: 4. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Sayf ibn ‘Amirah who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘It is not unlawful for one to marry in the manner of al- Mut‘ah (advantageous marriage) the slave-girl of a woman but if the master is a man then al-Mut‘ah (advantageous marriage) with her is not permissible without the permission of her master.’”
